dialogue.raw_text: Because that would be too easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Full of life, Bob plays basketball with some local guys. All over the court, and towering over the other players, Bob dominates the game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob looks at himself in the bathroom mirror, he feels his stubble and sees that it's turning grey. He opens the hotel shaving kit. He squirts shaving cream from the child-size can. Even the razor is small. He covers his face with shaving cream when the phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up and shaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Harris, we have fax for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want I send it to your room?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob gets out of the elevator- the Suntory group is waiting for him. He ducks behind a wall and sneaks out a side entrance of the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob comes out of the hotel into the sunlight. The street is crowded with MOTORCYCLE GANGS going by, one waves a big flag. Bob watches the strange scene in the street for a moment, and then makes his way past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks down a little street in a more old-fashioned neighborhood. He's wearing new techno sneakers. He makes a call on his cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A light rain starts as he looks at a fax from Charlotte with a map she's drawn and tries to figure out where he is - there are no street signs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Kawasaki? It's Bob Harris... I'm not going to be able to do that interview today.., yeah... ok.... Yes, I'd love to stay to be on his talk show... sure.. ok... bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ICHICAN SUSHI - DAY Bob finally finds the small restaurant. The automatic door opens for him, and Charlotte, at the bar with the cute chubby SUSHI CHEF, turns to Bob happy to see him. He is disheveled from the rain and adorable. He sits down next to Charlotte, she pours him a beer and orders for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A perky recording voice says "Kornichiwa!" from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls a pink Hello Kitty watch from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sushi Chef gives him perfect little pieces of sushi on a banana leaf. Charlotte takes a bite of a piece - but it won't break, so she has to stuff the whole thing in her mouth, embarrassed. Bob makes fun of her gracelessness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have lunch, he makes her laugh. He looks down at her feet in flip flops, her toe is purple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She slips her shoe off and shows it to him- her middle toe is black and blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She enjoys the sympathy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They really have to work on that street name thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, I think maybe I broke it? I knocked into something the other day...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We should get you to the doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob tries to get a taxi, finally one stops and they get in. He tries to explain "hospital", he does pantomime, draws a first aid cross, but the DRIVER doesn't understand. Charlotte is enjoying Bob's effort. Finally he finds a Park Hyatt matchbook and calls the hotel number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She transfers call, it rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tells the Driver who looks at him funny. Bob says it again- faster, with a Japanese accent. The driver nods excitedly and drives off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you say "hospital" in Japanese?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Concierge desk, may I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, can you tell me how to say "hospital" in Japanese?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob and Charlotte walk in, looking around at where to go. Bob talks to a woman at the desk to explain what they need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob takes a seat in waiting area as Charlotte goes into a little room with a number on it. Bob waits next to a 100 year old lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte stands alone barefoot on a little box, wearing a lead apron, as a MAN and ASSISTANT X-ray different angles of her foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob looks around at all the Japanese gift stuff, and buys a little stuffed bunny. His phone rings as he's paying for it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) So, we got you on an earlier flight, but I really think you should think about staying for that talk show.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Charlotte's foot X-rays are displayed on a big light box. An older DOCTOR talks about them in Japanese to his younger ASSISTANT as he wraps Charlotte's toes together. She doesn't know what they're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte comes out where Bob waits with the little stuffed bunny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob and Charlotte arrive back at the massive hotel, they stroll in casually, she is carrying the stuffed rabbit in her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob reclines in the big Japanese wooden tub, steam rises as he is turning red. His phone rings. He dries his hands quickly to reach it before it stops ringing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (O.S.) It's really hard to reach you... Did you get the carpet samples? I like the burgundy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok, whatever you think... I'm lost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not what I'm talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Is there anything I can do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... I want to be more healthy. I want to eat better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (sarcastic) Why don't you just stay there, and you can have it everyday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I have to go, Adam's tormenting Zoe, I'll talk to you later. Are you going to be Ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob rides in the back of a cab.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (voice-mail message) Hi Bob, it's Charlotte... how are you doing today?... I'm going to meet Charlie and those guys at this place called Orange around ten... come meet us if you get this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob's cab pulls up at an empty office building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob looks at a fax from Charlotte with a map, wondering if he's in the right place. It's quiet and looks like a generic office building. He goes in the little metal elevator, and the door opens on the 8th floor onto a little nightclub you would have never thought was there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lights strobe and Peaches' seedy "Fuck the Pain Away" booms through the speakers. Tan JAPANESE STRIPPERS with platinum hair dance and hang from a pole on a little platform. Bob sits alone on a brown ultra suede couch feeling out of place and empty. He looks over at a table of young AMERICAN INVESTMENT BROKERS. He wishes he wasn't there, but tries to seem comfortable. Charlotte shows up with Charlie and the other guys. She sits down next to him, and gives him an 'are you going to kill me?' look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her like it's been forever. She smiles for forgiveness. They look over and see a WEIRD GUY in the corner getting a lap dance, they look at each other, sharing the joke of the place, but both uncomfortable about the sexuality of it. Through a beaded curtain, Charlie and Bambi get lap dances in a dark corner of pillows. Charlotte looks at Bob.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long have you been here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob and Charlotte go up to a cab, but the driver refuses them. They don't know why, but just make their way down an empty side street. Little plastic cherry blossom decorations hang above them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She puts a coin in a vending machine and takes a cold sake "one-cup". A tiny brad Pitt head smiles at her next to an iced coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They keep walking, small figures on a little empty street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (like she's said it a million times) Working.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know where we are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't it weird there are no street names in Tokyo... you'd think a city like this would have street names... you need a map to get anywhere... look, there are no signs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As they make their way back, they pass a lounge off the lobby. It's late, it's pretty empty,  a housekeeper vacuums and just a SLEEPING MAN sits in the back of the lounge, and a snuggled up romantic JAPANESE COUPLE sit close to: Kelly, the blonde actress, singing to them. She stands facing them with a karaoke mic singing "Nobody Does It Better" with all her heart. Bob and Charlotte look at each other and keep walking (trying to be invisible).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte lies in bed. She picks up a photo next to the bed as she dials the phone.- The picture is of her and John on their honeymoon. The phone answers - it's a weird Japanese recording.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Um..Hi, John, if this is your phone? I'm not sure...I'm going to go to Kyoto for the day...I'11 try you when I get back. Hope it's going good... I love you, bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Charlotte watches the Japanese countryside go by out her window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlotte walks through a beautiful garden. She's a small figure in the landscape. She approaches a temple where she stops to watch a wedding procession. A young bride and groom in traditional kimono walk under a parasol with their family. Charlotte looks as- the nervous, young bride clutches her mother's hand. The young groom walks along with them. Charlotte is moved by the whole scene, the beauty of the temple and the wedding party. Her eyes well up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She walks up a narrow path, surrounded by red maple leaves. At the top of a little hill, she comes up to a shrine. At its entrance she sees a tree covered in little white pieces of paper tied to its branches. She sees Japanese people writing on the paper and tying them to the tree. Charlotte writes her wish on a paper and ties it to a branch. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .V. STUDIO - DAY Exciting music plays as the talk/game show starts. Bob, in an elegant suit, goes out to meet the HOST.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in Japanese) We hear you're quite a golfer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: translates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Translator translates - four sentences longer and with added enthusiasm. After a few questions the Host excitedly announces something to the AUDIENCE in Japanese. They scream, the lights flash, Bob has no idea what's going on. A cloud of smoke reveals the IRON CHEF, with feathered hair, wearing an 18th century waistcoat.  A large red chef hat is placed on Bob's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob looks around as a counter is pulled up to him and now Bob and the Iron Chef are at dueling counters. The Host barks instructions in Japanese, an apron with a stuffed animal lobster on it is tied around Bob, the crowd cheers - there's no way out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They now have the competition for you with the Iron Chef.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob rides in the back of the presidential, looking out the window at the city. He pulls a polaroid out of his pocket and looks at it. It's Charlotte, peering over her shoulder with a little smile, from their sake-drenched night at Nobu's compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melodramatic '70s Japanese music plays. Bob sits alone, hating himself, at the bar. The redheaded Jazz Singer takes a break, and a seat next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the harsh-morning light, Bob wakes up in his bed. He hears the Jazz Singer singing in the shower "Midnight at the Oasis". Her red mane of hair passes frame as she ushers in room service. She seems to have taken over the whole room. He wants it all to go away. She walks off to the bathroom and there's a knock at the door. Bob rushes to get it before she can. He opens the door a crack, Charlotte looking sweet, is standing there. Her hair is back in a pony-tail. Bob's just wearing a towel around his waist, and his hair is sticking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not in the mood, he looks at her like he already hates himself, doesn't need more help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The singer starts singing again in the background. Charlotte gives Bob a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He watches Charlotte walk away down the beige hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to Daikanyama, do you want to come walk around?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but no, I can't right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I guess you're busy, huh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob is walking down the crowded street looking for Charlotte, when his cell phone rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little girl's voice shouts "No!" in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the background the daughter calls for her Mommy over and over and a dog starts barking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I couldn't hear you. How are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Do you want to talk to  Zoe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (calls in background) Zoe, come say hello to your father...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Her ballet recital is Saturday, don't forget.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Ok, well, travel safely. See you soon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Charlotte, with sunglasses on, leans against the wall as Bob approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes with him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You can't get sushi anywhere in Japan after 2 o'clock. Did you know that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, we'll find something around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob and Charlotte are seated at a big booth in a corny Shabu Shabu restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob looks at her like- don't make it worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She scowls at him. The waitress brings them drinks- she pours beer slowly, and turns on a pot on the table to cook their food. Charlotte looks at the menu - it is filled with photos of different trays of meat. The waitress doesn't speak English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have trouble ordering, but point to a picture on the menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He makes some small talk, she is bugged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He orders the drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "This is the End" by The Doors starts playing on the stereo. The waitress brings two huge trays of sliced raw beef. Steam rises from the pot on the table. The song ends, and another Doors song comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look across the table, over the steam and meat, at each other- the whole thing is awful.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I guess she's more around your age...  You guys could talk about things in common, like growing up in the fifties.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a brat, wasn't there anyone else around to lavish you with attention?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want to drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're not going to play the whole album, are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the darkness, under covers, Charlotte is woken up by a loud fire alarm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fire alarm booms as the hotel guests and staff hurry out of the hotel. Amidst the crowd of Hotel guests in their pajamas, Charlotte finds Bob- he's wearing a kimono and slippers. She's in boxer shorts and an undershirt and slippers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs. She looks down at his feet stuffed into the little hotel slippers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That lunch was the worst, huh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what you said the other night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I mean it more now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and Charlotte, still in their pajamas, sit at their usual spot at the bar, with the bartender, drinking cold sake. She lights two cigarettes and passes one to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is now playing. The SINGER is full of enthusiasm as they start their stint at the Park Hyatt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sings "Where or When" with all his heart. Now, old-timers there, Bob and Charlotte look at each other and chuckle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob and Charlotte sit there together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (alt Charlotte dialog: I don't know it just doesn't, reality changes things...and we can't stay here forever) He looks over at her. The singer continues Where or When, as they sit there together, the view sparkling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good Evening. I'm Carl West, and we're thrilled to be joining you this week, here at the NY bar in Shinjuku.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jt seems we stood and talked like this before,   we looked at  each other in  the same way thenr   but I cant remember where or when...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to go back tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. But, it doesn't last, you have to go back sometime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, it just doesn't, reality changes things....we can't stay here forever, unless maybe we started a Jazz band.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.C.) Somethings  that happen for the first time,   seem to be happening again and so it  seems we have met before, and laughed before,   and loved before,   but who knows where or when...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob and Charlotte, drunk in the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods, she pushes 54 for him and 56 for herself. They look at each other across the empty elevator, both leaning against the walls. The elevator stops at 54, he leans in to kiss her good-night. They kiss like you would on the cheek- but it's closer to their mouths. The door shuts- he missed his floor. The elevator continues up, and stops on her floor. They kiss good-night again and she gets out before the door closes. He watches the door close on her as she makes her way down the long beige hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fax comes through the machine in the empty room.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IT'S A NOTE AND CUTE DRAWING FROM JOHN
SEE YOU ON SATURDAY, I MISS YOU

direction.raw_text: A sexy EXECUTIVE WOMAN asks Bob for a light. He looks at her great legs as he lights her cigarette. He looks around, keeping an eye out for Charlotte. The group of commercial people arrive to see him off. He excuses himself for a moment and goes to a phone on a little table in the corner. Bob picks up the house phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Traditional Japanese music plays on hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob gets the room voice-mail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up, feeling lame.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Uh...Hi, Charlotte... it's me, Bob... ok, I guess you're not there... wanted to say good-bye...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob with his bags tries to call again. The commercial people and hotel staff crowd around to help him, asking about his stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A member of the hotel staff brings him an envelope on a little silver tray. Miss Kawasaki gives him some gifts from their company in traditional Japanese wrapping, he doesn't know what to do with them and has to carry them. The Executive Woman from the bar walks up to him. He hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at him like, we could have had some fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees Charlotte come out of the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rushes over to Charlotte. She looks at his bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hands him his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She waits for him to say something more. He wants to tell her he loves her, that she should come with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The concierge tells him his car is here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks away. A hotel manager asks Bob about his luggage, another asks if he had a pleasant stay. Charlotte gets in the elevator to go out, the doors close on her back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm just leaving.... do you have my jacket?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, yeah... I'll bring it down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ok, see you in a second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to go, thanks, bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just saying good-bye to everyone before you leave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's bright outside the main entrance. A presidential pulls up and the automatic door opens. Bob squints as the Bellboy in white gloves slowly loads his luggage into the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the backseat, Bob leans back on the little doily. The car pulls away. Around the corner, he looks down a crowded alley and sees Charlotte's blonde hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DRIVER, wearing white cloth gloves, pulls the car over slowly. Bob tries to open the door'99 it won't open, he has to wait for the automatic doors to open for him (slowly).
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can you pull over a second?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob gets out and rushes down the street to where he saw Charlotte. The street is crowded with JAPANESE PEOPLE, and different colored umbrellas, (it's sunny out with a light rain). Music blasts from speakers on the street, and there is some promo going on with GIRLS handing out little cologne samples. Bob looks around for her, but only sees dark hair, umbrellas, and super tan JAPANESE KIDS. In the distance an umbrella moves to reveal Charlotte.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she can't hear him over the loudspeaker. He rushes to her. C.U. she turns and we see she is crying. The music swells. He embraces her, holding her close to him in the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses her, hugs her good-bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds her close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Charlotte watches Bob as he reaches his car, he turns and looks at her. She smiles at him, and is lost in the crowd. Bob gets into his car. CUT TO: Charlotte walks with the crowd as they go on their way. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know, I'm going to miss you, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Back in the Presidential, alone, Bob leans against the little doily.  They drive off. He looks out the window, Bob's happy he's going home, he's happy he came to Tokyo. Bob's P.O.V.-  Tokyo goes past his window.
direction.name: direction
